title: Support-Nerf Pattern
body:
It might just be me, but it looks like there's a pattern in Riot nerfing supports...

Soraka starts being picked in top and mid lane - Reworked
Annie is picked in mid more than support - Nerf scaling
Alister is being picked jungle - Remove jungle cow
Sona is being picked mid - Nerf over several patches

It might just be coincidence, but whenever a support starts seeing a significant amount of picks in a different position they get nerfed...
And yet Riot says they're *support*ive of the meta-breaking.

Huehuehuehuehue puns.

replies.body:
Uh, riot nerfed annie's bases and buffed her ratios because she was getting picked as support, not the other way around.

Sona barely sees play outside of support, and mid sona isn't even that good due to no waveclear. They nerfed her because of support sona, which still probably didn't deserve it. 

Alistar was picked in jungle many seasons ago, and it was terrifying, even more so than any of the s4 jungle picks. They did not nerf his passive as a result of him going jungle, but out of fear of him doing it again. In fact, after alistar received that buff to his ult, he started seeing play top lane. It was only after that happened that they nerfed his ability to sneak an aa in during his w.

The only one of your examples that is actually valid is raka being reworked.
I would much rather see an Ali jungle than a lee or j4.

I don't know, I heard jungler Alistar's ganks were LEGENDARY back in his heyday.

My favorite is the flash over wraith wall into head-butt that shoves the enemy mid-laner out from under their tower. Follow up pulverize for an easy (and completely unexpected) kill.

* R- Hits up to 5 targets, hitting 2 somewhat reliably.
* All of her auras can affect 5 allies, in a duo lane 2 reliably.
* Passive- Single target

Playing Sona in a solo lane compared to a duo lane is using roughly half of her kit.  If she is winning with half of her kit's potential then something is probably wrong there.
